meanings.definition: Holding fast; characterized by keeping a firm hold.
meanings.sent1: The tenacious grip of the child on the toy showed how determined he was.
meanings.sent2: The climber's tenacious hold on the rock helped him reach the summit.
meanings.sent3: The tenacious squirrel refused to let go of the acorn, even when chased by a dog.
meanings.sent4: Her tenacious commitment to her goals was like a strong anchor in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tenacious vine clinging to the wall stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: Persistent in maintaining, adhering to, or seeking something valued or desired.
meanings.sent1: The tenacious student never gave up on solving the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent2: The detective's tenacious pursuit of the suspect led to a breakthrough in the case.
meanings.sent3: The tenacious cat kept meowing until it got the attention it wanted.
meanings.sent4: Her tenacious dedication to her craft was like a beacon of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her tenacious spirit lingered long after she left.

meanings.sent1: The tenacious student remembered every detail of the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The elderly man's tenacious memory allowed him to recall stories from his youth.
meanings.sent3: The tenacious computer never forgot a single piece of information.
meanings.sent4: Her tenacious mind was like a vault storing precious memories.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tenacious elephant never forgetting a face was heartwarming.
